title: ExtensionSchema
description: Schema representing the structure of extension.yaml for AZD Extensions. Provides comprehensive metadata with enhanced inline documentation for improved authoring experience.

ExtensionExample.title: Extension Example
ExtensionExample.description: An example demonstrating how to use the extension.

name.title: Example Name
name.description: A brief name for the example.

description.title: Example Description
description.description: Detailed explanation of what the example demonstrates.

usage.title: Example Usage
usage.description: Command or instructions that show how to use this example.

ExtensionDependency.title: Extension Dependency
ExtensionDependency.description: A dependency required by this extension.

id.title: Dependency ID
id.description: Unique identifier of the dependent extension.

version.title: Dependency Version
version.description: The required version or version range, following semantic versioning.

Provider.title: Provider
Provider.description: A provider registered by this extension.

name.title: Provider Name
name.description: Unique identifier for this provider within the extension.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of what this provider does.

id.title: Extension ID
id.description: A unique identifier for the extension.

namespace.title: Extension Namespace
namespace.description: Namespace used to group extension commands; optional.

entryPoint.title: Entry Point
entryPoint.description: Executable or script that serves as the entry point of the extension; optional.

version.title: Extension Version
version.description: Semantic version of the extension. Use the format MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH (optionally with a pre-release tag).

capabilities.title: Capabilities
capabilities.description: List of capabilities provided by the extension. Supported values: custom-commands, lifecycle-events, mcp-server, service-target-provider. Select one or more from the allowed list. Each value must be unique.

oneOf.title: Custom Commands
oneOf.description: Custom commands expose new command groups and commands to AZD.

oneOf.title: Lifecycle Events
oneOf.description: Lifecycle events enable extensions to subscribe to AZD project and service lifecycle events.

oneOf.title: MCP Server
oneOf.description: MCP server capability enables extensions to provide Model Context Protocol tools that can be used by AI agents.

oneOf.title: Service Target Provider
oneOf.description: Service target provider enables extensions to provide custom service deployment targets.

oneOf.title: Framework Service Provider
oneOf.description: Framework service provider enables extensions to provide custom language frameworks and build systems.

description.title: Description
description.description: A detailed description of the extension including its features and purpose.

usage.title: Usage
usage.description: Instructions or details on how to use the extension.

examples.title: Examples
examples.description: Usage examples that help illustrate how the extension can be used.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Keywords to help categorize and filter the extension.

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: List of other extensions that this extension depends on. These will be resolved and installed automatically.

providers.title: Providers
providers.description: List of providers that this extension registers. Each provider must have a corresponding capability declared.

platforms.title: Platform Metadata
platforms.description: Optional, platform-specific metadata to tailor the extension for different environments.

additionalProperties.title: Platform Specific
additionalProperties.description: Custom metadata for a particular platform.

mcp.title: MCP Configuration
mcp.description: Configuration for Model Context Protocol server functionality. Required when mcp-server capability is declared.

serve.title: MCP Server Configuration
serve.description: Configuration for starting the extension's MCP server.

args.title: Server Arguments
args.description: Command-line arguments to pass when starting the MCP server. Typically ['mcp', 'serve'] or similar.

env.title: Environment Variables
env.description: Additional environment variables to set when starting the MCP server.
